result.execSummary:
All charges against Marcus Lamar Mckee in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus Lamar Mckee is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Ltr from Atty. Mehlos re the 07.14.22 Pretrial Conference.

Case Called: 10:46 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall in person for ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears in person, in custody, and with Atty Corey Mehlos in person.
VRCW.
Testifier Jessica Allen sworn and testifies - Identifies Defendant.
Parties make arguments.
Court addresses the parties; Court makes findings.
COURT finds that State has not met the burden of Probable Cause- Court Does not find Probable Cause.
Court Dismisses Matter. 

Cash bond is Dismissed as well 

C: Br. 6

Case called: 2:04p.m.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence for ADA Hannah Boeck.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, with Attorney Corey Mehlos via Zoom video.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $30,000.00 cash bond.
No contact with victim(s): T.L.K. 
No contact with codefendant(s): Keanan Brown.
Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
No possession or use of dangerous weapons. 
Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Dates:
PH: 7/6/22 at 9:50a.m. Br. 1
PTC: 7/14/22 at 10:40a.m.

ADJ: 2:17p.m.

Preliminary Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:50 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 10:40 am.

No contact with victim, T.L.K. and Co-defendant, Keanan Brown. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk Micki.
